author: simevo
body:
Hi, while pwsh itself is MIT-licensed, it "_ALSO CONTAINS THIRD PARTY AND OTHER PROPRIETARY SOFTWARE THAT ARE GOVERNED BY SEPARATE LICENSE TERMS_".

Looking at this file:
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/license_thirdparty_proprietary.txt#L417
it would seem that pwsh "INCLUDES" .NET, which has quite a lot of limitations.

But I understand that pwsh 6.0 can be "linked" with .NET Core which is also MIT licensed !

Can you please clarify / simplify the license terms ?

This could be a showstopper for pwsh diffusion on open source OSs:
https://bugs.debian.org/834756#16

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @simevo Thanks for your question! We already have #5869
